description: The White House revealed President Trump has been diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency. It is a common vein condition in people over age 70, and the president’s doctor says he remains in “excellent health.” NBC News’ Garrett Haake reports.
title: Trump diagnosed with common vein condition

author: Erika Edwards
description: President Donald Trump has been diagnosed with a condition that causes blood to pool in his legs after he was examined for “mild swelling in his lower legs,” White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said Thursday
title: What is chronic venous insufficiency, Trump's diagnosis?

author: Deon J. Hampton
description: Alabama Gov. Kay Ivey is supporting a state agency’s refusal to release body camera footage in the fatal police shooting of an 18-year-old Black college freshman, saying the case must first be thoroughly investigated
title: Alabama governor backs withholding video of officer fatally shooting Black student

author: Corky Siemaszko
description: Rep. Jim Jordan of Ohio, one of the Republican Party’s top inquisitors in Congress, is expected to be deposed Friday about allegations that he failed to protect the wrestlers he once coached at Ohio State University from a sexual predator, four plaintiffs in lawsuits against the university told NBC News
title: Rep. Jim Jordan faces deposition about OSU sex abuse scandal

author: Samantha Genzer
description: The former Fleetwood Mac bandmates posted coordinated lyrics from “Frozen Love” a day after Mick Fleetwood praised the song on his Instagram.
title: Stevie Nicks and Lindsey Buckingham cryptically post lyrics, prompting landslide of reactions from fans

author: The Politics Desk
description: Kentucky Democratic Gov. Andy Beshear touted his red-state credentials during a trip to South Carolina, testing a potential 2028 presidential primary message.
title: A red-state Democrat test-drives a 2028 message: From the Politics Desk

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: The federal agency will use Medicaid data to identify and locate people they believe are unlawfully present in the country.
title: ICE will get access to Medicaid enrollees' personal information

author: Adam Edelman
description: As she trails in polls and fundraising, Virginia's GOP gubernatorial nominee has demoted her campaign manager and parted ways with her political director.
title: Republican Winsome Earle-Sears shakes up campaign staff in Virginia governor's race

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A day after she was fired from her job as a U.S. attorney, Maurene Comey — the daughter of former FBI Director James Comey — urged her colleagues not to let fear of retribution "seep into" their decisions and to fight back against "abuses of power.""Every person lucky enough to work in this office constantly hears four words to describe our ethos: Without Fear or Favor.
title: Maurene Comey urges DOJ colleagues to stand up to 'abuses of power' in memo after her firing

author: Brooke Sopelsa
description: The Trump administration has terminated the 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline’s LGBTQ youth service, which gave callers under age 25 the option to speak with LGBTQ-trained counselors.
title: Trump administration shuts down LGBTQ youth suicide hotline

author: The Associated Press
description: Two days of heavy downpours in South Korea have killed at least four people and forced more than 1,300 others to evacuate, officials said Thursday.
title: At least 4 dead and 1,300 evacuated after heavy rain in South Korea

author: Dareh Gregorian
description: President Donald Trump will not appoint a special counsel to review the Jeffrey Epstein case, the White House said Thursday, shooting down a move that several of his allies have advocated.
title: Trump is not interested in naming a special counsel for the Jeffrey Epstein case, White House says

author: Deon J. Hampton
description: Federal lawmakers on Wednesday introduced four bills aimed at banning or regulating dangerous chemicals in hair and beauty products largely marketed toward Black women
title: Congress targets hair products with cancer-causing ingredients marketed to Black women

author: Denise Chow
description: More than 3,000 flash flood warnings have been issued in the U.S. so far this year — the highest number on record, according to data from Iowa State University.
title: U.S. hit with record number of flash flood warnings

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Denise Richards has been granted a temporary restraining order against her estranged husband Aaron Phypers after she accused him of domestic violence, verbal abuse and showed the court photos of a black-eye she endured
title: Denise Richards gets restraining order against husband Aaron Phypers, alleges physical and verbal abuse

author: Ryan J. Reilly
description: Former Voice of America employee arrested for threats against Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene
title: Former Voice of America employee charged with threats against Marjorie Taylor Greene

author: Rob Wile
description: Looking for a wedding dress?
title: OpenAI's ChatGPT 'agent' is ready to assist you

description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt gave a health update on President Trump and said he had been diagnosed with a "chronic venous insufficiency" after being examined for swelling in his legs. Leavitt added that this is a benign and common condition and there was no evidence of arterial disease.
title: White House says Trump diagnosed with 'chronic venous insufficiency'

author: Aria Bendix
description: Juul Labs can continue to sell its e-cigarettes and refill cartridges per a decision Thursday by the Food and Drug Administration.
title: Juul can continue to sell e-cigarettes, FDA says

author: The Associated Press
description: Eight healthy babies were born in Britain with the help of an experimental technique that uses DNA from three people
title: Healthy babies born from DNA of three people to prevent inherited diseases

author: Alexandra Marquez
description: GREENVILLE, S.C. — In an early preview of a potential 2028 presidential campaign, Kentucky Gov.
title: Andy Beshear, a Democratic governor of a deep-red state, tests a 2028 message

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: Chris Martin, the lead singer of Coldplay, called out a couple who hid their faces after being caught on a kiss camera during a show on Wednesday, saying they looked like they were having an affair.
title: Chris Martin jokes couple is ‘having an affair’ at Coldplay concert after man ducks on kiss cam

author: David K. Li
description: Kansas City Chiefs wide receiver Rashee Rice pleaded guilty to charges connected to a high-speed crash in Dallas last year and agreed to a 30-day jail sentence, officials said Thursday.
title: Kansas City Chiefs wide receiver Rashee Rice sentenced to 30 days in jail for high speed crash

author: Frank Thorp V
description: Democrats walked out of a Senate Judiciary Committee meeting Thursday to advance senior Justice Department official Emil Bove's nomination for a federal judgeship, alleging Republicans improperly rushed the process
title: Democrats walk out of committee meeting mid-vote on Trump judicial nominee Emil Bove

author: Pilar Melendez
description: A 17-year-old boy has been arrested in connection with the mysterious killing of a paddleboarder in Maine earlier this month, police said on Thursday
title: Teen arrested in connection with Maine paddleboarder's murder

author: Daniella Silva
description: Attorneys say Abel Orozco's arrest violates a legal mandate requiring probable cause in order to arrest an immigrant without first obtaining a warrant.
title: Immigrant father in the U.S. for 30 years is challenging warrantless ICE arrests

author: Shreya Srinivasan
description: While working as a youth camp doctor in upstate New York earlier this summer, Dr.
title: Why are tick bites sending so many people to the emergency room this summer?

description: Democrats walked out of a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing on Emil Bove's judicial nomination as Sen. Cory Booker, D-N.J., accused Republicans of rushing the process.
title: Senate Democrats walk out of hearing on Emil Bove's judicial nomination

author: Aria Bendix
description: Gastrointestinal cancers, which include colorectal, stomach and pancreatic cancer, are rising dramatically in younger adults. Doctors aren’t fully sure why.
title: Gastrointestinal cancers are rising dramatically in people under 50

author: The Associated Press
description: Britain will lower the voting age from 18 to 16 by the next national election as part of measures to increase democratic participation, the government announced.
title: Britain will lower its voting age to 16 in a bid to strengthen democracy

author: David K. Li
description: Former NFL linebacker and Super Bowl winner Bryan Braman died Wednesday night after being diagnosed with brain cancer months ago, his agent said.
title: Bryan Braman, former Eagles player and Super Bowl champ, dies at 38 after brain cancer diagnosis

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Backstreet Boys singer Brian Littrell filed court documents accusing a Florida sheriff's office of failing to remove beachgoers who trespass on his oceanfront property and is asking a judge to intervene.
title: Backstreet Boys singer Brian Littrell sues Florida sheriff's office over trespassers on his beachfront home

author: Dareh Gregorian
description: President Donald Trump is facing growing pressure, including from some of his closest allies, for more transparency on the Jeffrey Epstein case.
title: What should Trump do about Epstein questions? MAGA has a few ideas

description: Connie Francis, who recently made headlines with her 1962 song “Pretty Little Baby” going viral on TikTok, has died at the age of 87. A pop star of the 1950s and 1960s, she was the first woman to have a No. 1 Billboard Hot 100 as a solo artist.
title: Connie Francis, ‘Pretty Little Baby’ Singer, Dies at 87

author: Evie Steele
description: The U.S. shipbuilding industry is looking for help.
title: A flagging U.S. industry looks for new life in a Philadelphia shipyard

description: A new U.S. assessment found American strikes destroyed one of three nuclear sites in Iran. The other two were damaged but nuclear enrichment could resume in the next several months if Iran wants it to, according to officials familiar with the assessment.
title: US Strikes Destroyed 1 of 3 Iran Nuclear Sites, Assessment Finds

description: The biggest names in sports were honored at the 2025 Espy Awards on Wednesday, including Simone Biles taking home trophies for Best Athlete in Women’s Sports and Best Championship Performance. Saquon Barkley also won Best Play for the iconic reverse hurdle and the Eagles also won for Best Team.
title: See the Highlights From the 2025 Espy Awards

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Singer Connie Francis, a star of the 1950s and ‘60s known for her hits "Pretty Little Baby" and "Stupid Cupid," has died, her publicist announced.
title: 'Pretty Little Baby' singer Connie Francis dies at 87

description: Bove, a former Trump attorney, has come under scrutiny for his actions at the Department of Justice.
title: Democrats walk out of committee meeting mid-vote on Trump judicial nominee Emil Bove

description: President Donald Trump is lashing out at some of his own supporters over their demands for more information about the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. “It’s all been a big hoax. It’s perpetrated by the Democrats and some stupid Republicans and foolish Republicans fall into the net,” Trump says. NBC’s Gabe Gutierrez reports for TODAY.
title: Trump Lashes out at 'Stupid Republicans' Over Epstein Files

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: A recent assessment suggests Iran would be able to resume nuclear enrichment within months, sources say.
title: Iran nuclear site assessment and DOJ fires Maurene Comey: Morning Rundown

author: Erika Edwards
description: Martha Martin has to use up all of her remaining vacation days for the year to stay home with her infant son, and it still won’t be enough.
title: Day care measles exposure forces Iowa family to take weeks off work for baby: 'It only takes one'

author: Gordon Lubold
description: President Trump rejected a military plan for more comprehensive strikes on Iran’s nuclear program that would have lasted weeks, NBC News has also learned.
title: New U.S. assessment finds American strikes destroyed only one of three Iranian nuclear sites

author: Chantal Da Silva
description: Syria's leader Ahmed al-Sharaa accused Israel on Thursday of sowing discord with a wave of airstrikes following deadly clashes with the Druze community.
title: Syria withdraws forces to avoid 'open war' with Israel after sectarian violence

author: Mithil Aggarwal
description: HONG KONG — Chinese authorities in Hong Kong have launched a criminal investigation after more than a dozen female students and teachers at the University of Hong Kong accused a male law student of using AI to generate deepfake porn images of them.
title: Hong Kong opens criminal probe into AI-generated porn scandal at city's oldest university

author: Rebecca Cohen
description: A 61-year-old man is dead after a group of people was struck by lightning at a New Jersey archery range Wednesday night, police said.
title: 1 dead, 13 injured by lightning strike at New Jersey archery range

author: Emilie Ikeda
description: Kayla Elliot thought she was helping a family who couldn't conceive by birthing a surrogate child for a couple in Southern California.
title: Surrogate was horrified to learn the couple she bore a baby for had 21 children

description: Federal prosecutor Maurene Comey, the daughter of former FBI director James Comey, was terminated by the Justice Department. Comey prosecuted Sean “Diddy” Combs and also played a role in the investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and the prosecution and conviction of his co-conspirator Ghislaine Maxwell.
title: Federal prosecutor Maurene Comey fired by Department of Justice

author: Ryan J. Reilly
description: Comey prosecuted Sean “Diddy” Combs this year and played a role in the investigation and subsequent prosecutions of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
title: DOJ fires Maurene Comey, daughter of James Comey and a prosecutor in Sean Combs' and Ghislaine Maxwell's cases
